result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert V Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Probation may be transferred to Washington County. Court would consider early termination of probation after 18 months if all conditions have been met. 
-If Revoked- sentence credit of 2 days is granted.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
-As an alternative to payment, may complete additional community service as approved by agent. Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

-Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

-Anger management and domestic violence counseling to be deteremined by Agent. 
-Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommedned. 
-Obtain a valid driver's license within the first 6 months.
-Evaluate and consider further education. 
-No violent contact with Victims A and B. 
-Case 22CM967 is dismissed and read-in. 
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Complete 20 hours of Community Service each year of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert V Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, Robert V
defendant.address: N54w21560 Logan Dr, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

02:02 PM Defendant Robert V Krueger in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Case 22CM967 is dismissed and read in to this matter.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Withheld sentence (Credit for 2 days if revoked)

Term of Probation: 2 Years. Probation may be transferred to Washington County.  Court would consider early termination of probation after 18 months if all conditions have been met.
Conditions of Probation:
-	No violent contact with Victims A and B.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Mental Health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; 
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Anger management and domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
-	Obtain a valid Driver's License within the first 6 months;
-	Complete 20 hours of community service each year of probation;
-	Evaluate and consider further education.

RESTITUTION: $ 0.00 (zero)

COSTS:  $ 253.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.  As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete additional community service as approved by the Agent.  Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.


Count 2:
Withheld sentence (Credit for 2 days if revoked)

Term of Probation: 2 Years. Probation may be transferred to Washington County.  Court would consider early termination of probation after 18 months if all conditions have been met.
Conditions of Probation:
-	Same as Count 1

COSTS:  $ 253.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.  As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete additional community service as approved by the Agent.  Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter to Court requesting hearing on 8-19-22 be converted to a Plea and Sentencing Date, filed by Atty. Herbers.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 28, 2022 - Approved - Clerk to set early date.**

Case called at 11:03 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney J Andrew Herbers in court and appears by authorization.   Defendant Robert V Krueger did not appear.  
Attorney Herbers requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to Appear on behalf of defendant. Filed by Atty. Herbers Jr.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Atty. Herbers Jr.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A/Defendant's Father listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:39 AM Defendant Robert V Krueger in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on April 14, 2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
